word: The doctrine preached by Zwingle was not received from Luther. It was the doctrine of Christ. \93If Luther preaches Christ,\94 said the Swiss reformer, \93he does what I do. He has led to Christ many more souls than I;\97be it so. Yet will I bear no other name than that of Christ, whose soldier I am, and who alone is my head. Never has a single line been addressed by me to Luther, or by Luther to me. And why?\97That it might be manifest to all how uniform is the testimony of the Spirit of God, since we, who have had no communication with each other, agree so closely in the doctrine of Jesus Christ.\94
